events.title: Abolition of the British Slave Trade Act
events.description: The British Parliament passed the Abolition of the Slave Trade Act, banning the transatlantic slave trade in the British Empire.
events.significance: Marked a crucial step toward the eventual abolition of slavery and human trafficking in the British Empire, influencing global movements against slavery.

events.title: Signing of the Treaty of Rome
events.description: The Treaty of Rome was signed by six European countries, establishing the European Economic Community (EEC), a precursor to the European Union.
events.significance: Laid the foundation for European integration, fostering economic cooperation and political unity in Europe.

events.title: The Sex Discrimination Act 1975 comes into effect in the UK
events.description: This UK law made it illegal to discriminate against individuals on the basis of sex or marital status in employment, education, and provision of goods and services.
events.significance: Significant advancement in promoting gender equality and women's rights within the United Kingdom.

events.title: The Bloody Sunday March in Selma, Alabama
events.description: Although the main Bloody Sunday event occurred on March 7, other related civil rights marches and activities occurred on March 25, as activists continued to push for voting rights.
events.significance: Part of the broader Civil Rights Movement efforts that led to the Voting Rights Act of 1965, securing voting rights for African Americans.
